node.title: Socceroos primed for emotional homecoming
node.description: Socceroos boss GrahamÂ Arnold says he's seen a lot of emotion in his players ahead of playing on home soil for the first time in 763 days.
node.content:
["Socceroos coach Graham Arnold says he is looking forward to having Australia's 12th man back for Thursday's vital World Cup qualification match against Saudi Arabia in Parramatta.", "The Socceroos will be playing their first game on home soil in 763 days, since beating Nepal 5-0 in October\u00a02019.", "Saudi Arabia boast\u00a0a 100 per cent winning record in topping Group\u00a0B, but a\u00a0win will take the Socceroos above the Green Eagles on goal difference.", "With only two teams qualifying automatically from the group, a win would dramatically increase the Socceroos chances of reaching the\u00a02022 FIFA World Cup in Qatar.", "Arnold said he expects the home crowd to give his side a big lift.", "\"It's just so great to be back in Australia,\" Arnold said.", "\"The boys have come into camp with a lot of energy, some of them caught up with their families.", "Arnold said being back in Australia was emotional for some players, some of whom were seeing their families for the first time in three years.", "\"Bringing the families in [to camp]\u00a0for the boys to reconnect,\u00a0I have seen a lot of emotion,\" Arnold said.", "", "
The Socceroos have played all their \"home\" qualifiers since 2019 in Qatar, with much success.(Getty Images: Mohamed Farag)
", "\"Some of the players have not seen family for three years, some for 18 months and [they're]\u00a0getting rid of that emotion quickly, so controlling that is something I've been working on extremely hard.", "\"I believe the greatest energy that can be given to the players is to see their family, to know that their family is there behind them but also in the grandstand.", "The Socceroos have played 11 of their 12 qualification games\u00a0for the 2022\u00a0World Cup away from home, a sequence that included a world record 11-match winning run, ended only by a 2-1 defeat to Japan last month.", "Saudi Arabia, meanwhile, have played seven of their last eight World Cup qualifiers at home.", "", "
Mathew Leckie said the Socceroos are \"buzzing\" to play in front of their home fans.(Getty Images: Matt King)
", "New Melbourne City signing Mathew Leckie said playing at home was a big advantage.", "\"All the boys are buzzing,\" he said. \"A lot of the boys haven't been in Australia for so long.\"", "\"It's something that we've missed for a long time now. Home advantage is a big plus so the boys are going to be buzzing.\"", "Arnold said the absence of superstar players Tom Rogic, Aaron Mooy and Adam Taggart would not hurt his side, with Jamie Maclaren, Andrew Nabbout and Leckie all coming in.", "\"Not having those three players is seen in a lot of ways as a disadvantage, but I don't believe that because we've got some great players,\" Arnold said.", "\"We've got the depth to cover those performances so I expect a great performance.\"", "", "
Jamie Maclaren scored a hattrick the last time the Socceroos played on home soil.(AAP: James Gourley)
", "
When are the Socceroos playing?
", "The Socceroos kick off at 8:10pm AEDT at Western Sydney Stadium in Parramatta.", "That's 7:10pm in Queensland, 7:40pm in South Australia, 6:30pm in the Northern Territory and 5:10pm in Western Australia.", "
How can I watch?
", "The match will be broadcast on Channel 10 across the country, except in WA, who will have to watch on 10 Bold.", "The match is also available on 10 Play.", "You can also follow the match in our live blog from 7:30pm AEDT.", "
Standings
", "The top two teams qualify automatically for the 2022 World Cup in Qatar."]
